definitions.definition: An instrument used to measure or keep track of time; a non-portable timepiece.
The odometer of a motor vehicle.
definitions.example: This car has over 300,000 miles on the clock.

definitions.definition: An electrical signal that synchronizes timing among digital circuits of semiconductor chips or modules.
The seed head of a dandelion.

definitions.example: I can't go off to lunch yet: I'm still on the clock.

definitions.definition: A CPU clock cycle, or T-state.

definitions.example: He was clocked at 155 miles per hour.
When the boxer let down his guard, his opponent clocked him.

definitions.definition: To take notice of; to realise; to recognize someone or something
definitions.example: A trans person may be able to easily clock other trans people.

definitions.definition: To falsify the reading of the odometer of a vehicle.
definitions.example: I don't believe that car has done only 40,000 miles. It's been clocked.
Have you clocked that game yet?

definitions.definition: A pattern near the heel of a sock or stocking.
To ornament (e.g. the side of a stocking) with figured work.
A large beetle, especially the European dung beetle (Geotrupes stercorarius).
To make the sound of a hen; to cluck.
